Wilmington.Union Park Gardens, Wilmington, Delaware:
Union Park Gardens is a neighborhood located between Union Street and Lancaster Avenue in Wilmington, New Castle County, Delaware, United States, and designed by landscape architect John Nolen and the architect Emile G. Perrot of the firm Ballinger & Perrot during the First World War.  Union Park Gardens first served as housing for shipyard workers of the United States Shipping Board's Emergency Fleet Corporation.


== History ==
The Liberty Land Company and Lynch Construction Company built houses in Union Park Gardens for the United States Shipping Board during World War I. The term "Union Park" comes from the name of the amusement park once located on the site of the neighborhood.
